revised_title: The Influence of External Concentration on the Position of Equilibrium in the Intake of Salts by Plant Cells
tldr: This study investigates the influence of external concentration on the position of equilibrium attained in the intake of salts by plant cells. The authors found that the rate of absorption and the position of equilibrium are affected by the concentration of salts, providing valuable insights into plant nutrition and the mechanisms of salt intake and translocation in living plants.
